full_text: Page 3751 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-J DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 812 814 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 4:00-4:30 PM 414 415 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 12:30- 1:00 AM 838 839 4:30-5:00 PM 447 447 1:00-1:30 AM 909 911 5:00 -5:30 PM 502 503 1:30-2:00 AM 951 953 5:30-6:00 PM 5 5 2:00-2:30 AM 1020 1022 6:00-6:30 PM 605 605 2:30-3:00 AM 1037 1040 6:30-7:00 PM 638 640 3:00-3:30 AM 1102 1106 7:00-7:30 PM 705 707 3:30-4:00 AM 1154 1155 7:30-8:00 PM 738 738 4:00-4:30 AM 1223 1224 8:00-8:30 PM 805 805 4:30-5:00 AM 1234 1236 8:30- 9:00 PM 843 830 5:00 -5:30 AM 109 111 9:00-9:30 PM 806 806 5:30-6:00 AM 141 142 9:30-10:00 PM 939 939 6:00-6:30 AM 233 234 10:00-10:30 PM 1004 1004 6:30-7:00 AM 249 258 10:30-11:00 PM 1031 1038 7:00-7:30 AM 327 328 11:00-11:30 PM 1104 1104 7:30-8:00 AM 350 351 11:30-12:00 PM 1145 1145 MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00027066

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-J DATE: 08/10/2019
TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE
MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten entries in the table and some redactions.
